MS MCQs

    Enhance the user interface of your Windows 10 app - Summary and knowledge check

    »

    1. What’s the easiest way to pass information between pages in a Windows app?

      Record the information in the app’s code before you leave the first page, and read it from the same location when you load the second page.

      Information can’t be passed between pages in an app.

      You must use specific navigation methods to pass data between pages.

      You can pass additional information into the Frame.Navigate method, and the information will be passed to the target page.


    2. How does the Navigate method of a WebView or WebBrowser control work?

      Navigate directs the control to a web page to display.

      Navigate tells the control where to find valid HTML content, and the control displays the content.

      Navigate tells the control where to find valid HTML content, but not to display it.

      Navigate controls backward and forward movement in the control.


    3. In UWP, the MediaElement control has a CurrentStateChanged event that doesn’t exist in WPF. What does this event let you do?

      CurrentStateChanged lets you track the status of your MediaElement control.

      CurrentStateChanged enables you to use transport controls like streaming and timeline.

      CurrentStateChanged lets you consolidate all the code about your MediaElement’s status into a single event handler.

      CurrentStateChanged enables you to react to buffering events.
